gurmukhi: ਕਥਾ ਭੲੀ ੲਿਹ ਦਿਸ ੲਿਹ ਭਾਤਾ ॥ ਅਬ ਕਹੋ ਬਿਸਨ ਤ੍ਰੀਯਾ ਕੀ ਬਾਤਾ ॥
transliteration: Kathaa Bhaieh Dis Eh Bhaataa|| Ab Kaho Bisan Triyaa Kibaataa||
translation: How this story occurred? In this context, I relate the story of the wife of Vishnu :

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਰਿੰਦਾਰਿਕ ਦਿਨ ੲੇਕ ਪਕਾੲੇ ॥ ਦੈਤ ਸਭਾ ਤੈ ਬਿਸਨ ਬੁਲਾੲੇ ॥੫॥
transliteration: Brindaarik Din Ek Pakaae|| Dait Sabhaa Tai Bisan Bulaae||5||
translation: One day, he cooked the brinjals in her home and at the same time, Vishnu was called by the assembly of demons, where he went.5.

gurmukhi: ਅਾੲਿ ਗਯੋ ਤਹ ਨਾਰਦ ਰਿਖ ਬਰ ॥ ਬਿਸਨ ਨਾਰ ਕੇ ਧਾਮ ਛੁਧਾਤਰ ॥
transliteration: Aae Gado Tah Naarad Rich Bar|| Bisan Naar Ke Dhaam Chhadhaatar||
translation: At the same time, the great sage Narada reached the house of Vishnu and he was very hungry.

gurmukhi: ਬੈਂਗਨ ਨਿਰਖ ਅਧਿਕ ਲਲਚਾਯੋ ॥ ਮਾਂਗ ਰਹਿਯੋ ਪਰੁ ਹਾਥ ਨ ਅਾਯੋ ॥੬॥
transliteration: Baingad Nirakh Adhik Lalchadyo|| Maan Rahiyo Par(u) Haath Naa Aayo||6||
translation: Seeing the cooked vegetable of brinjals, his mind was tempted, but he did not get it even on asking for it.6.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਥ ਹੇਤ ਮੈ ਭੋਗ ਪਕਾਯੋ ॥ ਮਨੁਛ ਪਠੈ ਕਰ ਬਿਸਨ ਬੁਲਾਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Naath Het Mai Bhog Pakaayo|| Manouchh Padhhai Kar Bisan Bulaayo||
translation: The wife of Vishnu said that she had prepared that food for her lord, therefore it was not possible for her to give it, (she also said:) “I have sent a messenger to call him and the may be coming.”

gurmukhi: ਨਾਰਦ ਖਾੲਿ ਜੂਠ ਹੋ ਜੈਹੈ ॥ ਪੀਅ ਕੁਪਤ ਹਮਰੈ ਪਰ ਹੁਅੈਹੈ ॥੭॥
transliteration: Naarad Khaae Jeeth Ho Jaihai|| Peea Koupat Hamrai Par Huai-hai||7||
translation: The wife of Vishnu thought that if Narada partook it the food would become impure and her lord wound be angry with.7.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਂਗ ਥਕਯੋ ਮੁਨ ਭੋਜ ਨ ਦੀਅਾ ॥ ਅਧਿਕ ਰੋਸੁ ਮੁਨ ਬਰ ਤਬ ਕੀਅਾ ॥
transliteration: Maan Thakyo Mounndbhoj Na Deeaa|| Adhik Ros(u) Mounndbar Tab Keeaa||
translation: “The sage had been repeatedly asking for the food, but you did not give it to him.”

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਰਿੰਦਾ ਨਾਮ ਰਾਛਸੀ ਬਪੁ ਧਰ ॥ ਤ੍ਰੀਅ ਹੁਅ ਬਸੋ ਜਲੰਧਰ ਕੇ ਘਰ ॥੮॥
transliteration: Brindaa Naam Raachhasibap(u) Dhar|| Treea Hua Bado Jalandhar Ke Ghar||8||
translation: The sage flew into rage and said : “You will live in the house of the demon Jalandhar as wife named Varinda, after getting her body.”8.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਕਰ ਸ੍ਰਾਪ ਜਾਤ ਭਯੋ ਰਿਖਬਰ ॥ ਅਾਵਤ ਭਯੋ ਬਿਸਨ ਤਾਕੇ ਘਰ ॥
transliteration: Dekar Sraap Jaat Bhayo Rikhbar|| Aavat Bhayo Bisan Taake Ghar||
translation: No sooner than the sage departed after cursing her, Vishnu reached his home:

gurmukhi: ਸੁਨਤ ਸ੍ਰਾਪ ਅਤਿ ਹੀ ਦੁਖ ਪਾਯੋ ॥ ਬਿਹਸ ਬਚਨ ਤ੍ਰਿਯ ਸੰਗ ਸੁਨਾਯੋ ॥੯॥
transliteration: Sounat Sraap At(i) Hidoukh Paayo|| Bihas Bachanndtriya San Sounaayo||9||
translation: Hearing about the curse, he was greatly agonised and his wife smilingly confirmed (what the sage had said).9.
